OOC: On the bottom, like Zardus.

BIC: Stranato: I think we've had enough t=
o. Let's get the hell out of here.

Train Wreck transformed again and the o=
ther 6 Radicons climbed aboard. They drove off towards the Maximal City.

O=
OC: Don't look at me even though I'm writing this. I'm not in on this argum=
ent. Err, at least I'm not picking sides. I think yeah, Legendary Nemasis h=
as been playing Council some, but not enough for anyone to complain. I real=
ly don't see what the matter is, everyone seems to have been doing what the=
y've wanted to, recently, and have been following the rules fine. Alot of c=
ontroversy has been going on about certain things like bases and vehicles a=
nd changing of landscape, and everything has turned out fine. Because we tr=
ust each other, and have become like a quarreling family. I don't see why w=
e have to fight over something as lame as this. I learned to know better ab=
out useless fights now, so should everyone else. Thank you for reading my b=
oring piece of crap ramblings...

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: L=
egendarynemasis@... 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, Ju=
ly 26, 2001 11:34 AM
  Subject: Re: Slayer / Weaponfire in the ocean



  W=
ell that is the biggest exaggeration of anything that ive heard. As 
  RDah=
l stated Decpeticons and Autobots were firing missiles at each 
  other und=
erwater without any problems that he stated. And as for 
  physically possi=
ble, are we forgeting that TF physics and human 
  physics are two entirely=
 different things? And Yan who has 
  complained? I mean really if players =
have that many complaints about 
  something they should really have the gu=
ts to say something to the 
  player so that they may be able to clear up a=
ny questioning stuff. 
  Instead of going behind the players back and compl=
aining without 
  wanting any explanation. And Ive talked with a great many=
 players who 
  feel that way too. The point of the second Infecticon base =
is to be 
  heavily defended and hard to reach, because it is the most impo=
rtant. 
  > LN, the energy required to push a missile up from the bottom of=
 the 
  ocean ot anywhere would probably be able to power Manhatton (yeah, =
I 
  spelled it wrong, oh well) for several years. Having your base that 
 =
 far down under is a tradeoff I guess. I toned your weapons list down 
  wi=
thout realizing the depth, but with all the complaints I've been 
  getting=
 I think a good tradeoff (and physically possible) would be to 
  have almo=
st no defences since its that far down.
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > Also, LN, the co=
uncil's been recieving complaints about you acting 
  like a council member=
. You've been telling members what they can and 
  cannot do, and you've ma=
de quite alot of people's RPGing experience 
  much worse. Please stop this=
 instantly. The council has the job of 
  policeing the RPG, and we'll call=
 a mode if we see it. Until such a 
  time when you are on the council, tho=
ugh, please refrain from 
  attempting to moderate the RPG.




   

  Your=
 use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
